page.title: 19Traffic Problems (Continued)
page.content: Now huge lorries and tankers come down village lanes which are only just wide enough for two cars to pass. The result is that the banks retaining the fields are being broken down and cottagers are having to place stone blocks to protect their homes from damage. The greatest fear in the village is that our ancient bridge will collapse under the excessive stress, that homes will be shaken to pieces or that our children might suffer serious injury from the ever increasing volume of traffic passing through Culmstock.
